intro: Ouratea retrorsa, commonly known as the backward Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature.
